On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Chris Brooks:

@Salesforce @WaitingOnEngineer Feedback from Dev:
There are records with incorrect values in the URL column of the ActivitySiteCollections Tier2 table in SPAC.db3.
Please confirm this by executing the following query on SPAC.db3 database,

SELECT * FROM ActivitySiteCollections WHERE URL IS NULL
UNION ALL
SELECT * FROM ActivitySiteCollections WHERE URL NOT LIKE
'https%' AND URL NOT LIKE '/%'
(See sharepoint "From Dev > dbquery.png" for additional visual)
Also, please get us the SPAC.db3 Tier2 database and the Activity data files scanned by NAM.

[DevOps CommentId:11859811]

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: SQLite script returned no errors or anything. Screenshot uploaded to the SP. Awaiting customer to upload the SPAC.db3 and activity monitor files.

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Increased priority - SPAC not collecting data is an issue for the customer because the longer we go without running, the longer scans will have to run later

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Chris Brooks:

@Salesforce Update Per Dev :
The invalid URLs in the SPAC tier2 db came from SPAA db during the data migration. This migration happens whenever SPAC version is upgraded from versions lower than 10602.
Currently working on a script to quickly fix the data with minimum impact.

[DevOps CommentId:11952952]
On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Hey Chris - any kinda eta on when we can expect the script?

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the Following Fields have been updated: 
Status has been changed to Awaiting Escalating Engineer.

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Michael Burrofato:

@Muhammad Kamran Siddique @Chris Brooks @Helen Randall @Salesforce @WaitingOnEngineer

From Dev:
Please execute the following query on the SPAA SQLite db,

SELECT ID, RelativePath as URL FROM Resources WHERE Type = 2 AND URL LIKE '/%;
--- CODE ---

If any URL in the result set starts with "/" instead of "https://",  

There will be a chance of an error.


The reason mentioned in previous comments, i.e., invalid URLs from the SPAA db, is only one possible source. This can also happen during the Activity scans. 

The permanent fix will ensure that the URLs are absolute before they are saved in the database.

[DevOps CommentId:11973850]

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Hey team- are we sure it needs run on spaa.db and not spac.db? Their SPAA scan has been chugging along for over 30 days now and it will break our hearts if we have to kill it.

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: If we run the fix on the SPAC db and then rerun the SPAC System scan and import, will this fix the issue immediately? Or do we have to run the select statement on the spaa db? Again, the SPAA scan has been running for over 30 days so we can't just stop it and start again easily.

On Escalation Ticket # 00439783 the new comment has been added: Muhammad Kamran Siddique:

@Salesforce @WaitingOnEngineer

Execute the queries from the previous comment on the SPAC db and save the changes.

Then, execute the SELECT query from the previous comment on the SPAC db. If it returns any result, let us know. 

Otherwise, please run the Activity scans and import.

Do not run any query on the SPAA db.

@Michael Burrofato @Chris Brooks
